title: Peridaedala speculata
text:
Peridaedala speculata is a species of <a href="moth">moth</a> of the family <a href="Tortricidae">Tortricidae</a> <a href="Species%20description">first described</a> by <a href="J%C3%B3zef%20Razowski">Józef Razowski</a> in 2013. It is found on <a href="Seram%20Island">Seram Island</a> in Indonesia. The habitat consists of upper montane forests.
The <a href="wingspan">wingspan</a> is about 17 mm. The forewings are green with white costal strigulae (fine streaks) in the posterior half of the wing with blackish divisions. The markings are also blackish. The hindwings are greyish.
Etymology.
The <a href="Specific%20name%20%28zoology%29">specific name</a> refers to the similarity to its <a href="Congener%20%28biology%29">congener</a>s and is derived from Latin "speculum" (meaning a similarity).
